results.title: To learn day by day
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Offers advice to child care providers on appropriate strategies to facilitate the learning of basic concepts such as big, round, etc. as well as number games and colours. Provides a strategy which involves starting with concepts and moving on to comparisons. Appropriate for professional Development and personal development (Home Economics) at VCE level.

results.title: Touch your toes & around we go
results.brief_description: Outlines and illustrates the perceived advantages of a multicultural approach to music and movement for preschool children, in a child care environment, especially those who use English as a second language. Appropriate for Professional Development (Home Economics) at VCE level. No other credits available.

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.

results.title: Coral reef
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, John Shaw, Greg Reading and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video takes us to Herron Island, describes the wildlife and then concentrates on the smaller prcesses of reef builders. This program takes a while to get started. The coral photography is very good.

results.title: AIDS
results.creator_credit: Joanne Parrent and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A broad approach that deals with the nature of AIDS, the means of infection, symptoms, prevention, advice and personal responsibilities in relationships. The comprehensive information involves no sexually explicit material and as such is particularly suitable as an introduction to the topic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanne Parrent and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Dianne Milwright, Dom Clausen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: As all children are different and develop at different rates it is not easy to identify school readiness. This program assists in identifying this stage by showing aspects of school life that children will encounter. Discusses how early experiences in the family and at preschool develop physical, social and intellectual maturity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dianne Milwright, Dom Clausen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions

results.title: Being five
results.creator_credit: Dianne Milwright, Donn Clauscen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: In the security of the family the foundations are laid for the child to take steps toward independence. At preschool the five-year-old has the opportunity to develop in a larger social group, building on and practising all those skills necessary for later learning. This video shows the conditions within the family, the preschool and the school which contribute towards a good attitude to learning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dianne Milwright, Donn Clauscen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions

results.title: Celebrating whole language
results.creator_credit: Dennis Claringbold, Keith Pigdon, Marilyn Woolley, Steve Macdonald and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Professors Ken and Yetta Goodman are interviewed by Howard Mould, Pat Long and Marilyn Woolley about the “Whole Language Approach” to language learning. The interviews are intercut with scenes of the Goodmans in classrooms in Victoria which illustrate their child-centred approach. A useful resource for parent-teacher evenings, professional development, curriculum days and ELIC courses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Claringbold, Keith Pigdon, Marilyn Woolley, Steve Macdonald and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre

results.title: Kangaroo creek gang: ...`do the right thing'
results.creator_credit: David Kefford, Terry Watt and Kangaroo Creek Gang
results.brief_description: An animated video which encourages primary school children to “Do the right thing’ when disposing of rubbish. Encourages children to place rubbish in bins and to sort for recycling. This video is part of a kit which includes an audiotape with songs and advice to teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Kefford, Terry Watt and Kangaroo Creek Gang
